page.title: 09A CROOKEDHOLM CHARACTER.
page.content: Mrs. Martin has great memories of the time she was at Crookedholm Primary School. She started in 1911. The headteacher was Mr. Adam Duncanson and she remembers him with great respect. The school hours were from 9am to 4pm. Her favourite subject was Music and her worst was parsing and analysis. She lived at the Granary, Mill Lane. During the war the school helped by growing vegetables in the front garden. Mr Paton, who lived at Templeton Burn, gave picnics at Templeton Burn and Xmas trips to the Palace Theatre for Pantomimes. Boys and Girls had separate playgrounds and didn't mix. The punishment was the strap. At playtime they played peevers, skipping and ball games. Mrs. Martin loved school and wanted to go to the Academy but there was fee-paying. She became a receptionist.
